intro: Ipomoea psilophylla, commonly known as the slender leaf morning glory, is a herbaceous vine native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its heart-shaped, thin leaves and strikingly large, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to violet. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and forest edges. Ipomoea psilophylla is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many other species of morning glories.
